Question.name: Q_54796
Question.title: Relationship of Tumor to Esophagogastric Junction (Note B)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_54796_1
Property.val: Relationship of Tumor to Esophagogastric Junction

ListItem.name: LI_18576
ListItem.title: Tumor is entirely located within the tubular esophagus and does not involve the esophagogastric junction

ListItem.name: LI_18577
ListItem.title: Tumor midpoint lies in the distal esophagus AND tumor involves the esophagogastric junction

ListItem.name: LI_18578
ListItem.title: Tumor midpoint is located at the esophagogastric junction

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52131
DisplayedItem.title: # Use the stomach checklist if either (1) the tumor involves the EGJ, but the midpoint is more than 2 cm into the proximal stomach or (2) the midpoint is less than 2 cm into the proximal stomach, but the tumor does not involve the EGJ

ListItem.name: LI_47803
ListItem.title: Tumor midpoint is 2 cm or less into the proximal stomach or cardia and tumor involves the esophagogastric junction#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_47803_1
Property.val: Tumor midpoint is 2 cm or less into the proximal stomach or cardia and tumor involves the esophagogastric junction

Property.val: Distance of Tumor Center from Esophagogastric Junction

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41466

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53136
DisplayedItem.title: # This histologic grade is not applicable to adenoid cystic carcinoma, mucoepidermoid carcinoma, well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor and high-grade neuroendocrine carcinoma.

ListItem.name: LI_18588
ListItem.title: High-grade dysplasia / carcinoma in situ (defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane)

Property.name: p_altTxt_53039_1
Property.val: Adjacent Site(s) Involved by Direct Tumor Extension

ListItem.name: LI_33412
ListItem.title: Present, with no viable cancer cells (complete response, score 0)

ListItem.name: LI_33413
ListItem.title: Present, with single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (near complete response, score 1)

ListItem.name: LI_33414
ListItem.title: Present, with residual cancer showing evident tumor regression, but more than single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (partial response, score 2)

ListItem.name: LI_33415
ListItem.title: Absent, with extensive residual cancer and no evident tumor regression (poor or no response, score 3)

ListItem.name: LI_367144
ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive carcinoma

Section.name: S_4187
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note H)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47409
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_47409_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327822
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_4190
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_4191
ListItem.title: pTis: High-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane

DisplayedItem.name: DI_40926
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa

ListItem.name: LI_4193
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae

ListItem.name: LI_4195
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria

ListItem.name: LI_37853
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum

ListItem.name: LI_37854
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway

ListItem.name: LI_327824
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327825
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_4200
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_4201
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_4202
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_4204
ListItem.title: pN3: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_18668
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_18668_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_33218
DisplayedItem.title: For HER2 reporting, the CAP Gastric HER2 template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
